title.narrative: Strenthening National and Regional Capacities for Effective Climate Risk Management in Togo

description.narrative: The proposed NAP Readiness will build on the results form the previous Readiness proposals by generating data and baseline information to inform the country programme, ii) generate regional disaggregated They will ensure that local development plans are compliant with their CCA needs and regulate grassroots development actions by integrating local adaptation priorities in accordance with standards. This new phase of the process will be backed by this proposal which will help remove the obstacles and achieve the following four outcomes: Outcome 3.1 ? ?Adaptation planning governance and institutional coordination strengthened?: to strengthen the coordination mechanisms of the CCA integration process in CCA planning and budgeting in Togo. This shall facilitate the commitment of local, decentralized and cross-sectorial stakeholders and will develop a long-term approach to capacity building for national adaptation planning and responses to climate change in Togo. Outcome 3.2 ? ?Evidence basis produced to design adaptation solutions for maximum impact?: to ensure that adaptation planning is based on the best available climatological and socio-economic information. This will help assess adaptation options and build the knowledge base by compiling existing information, assessing and bridging gaps and even suggesting new ones with regard to adaptation options. Outcome 3.3 - ?Private sector engagement in adaptation catalyzed?: to help consolidate the consultations of regional actors in assessing the costs and benefits of adaptation options / measures and support government efforts to mobilize local, private and external funding for the implementation of CCA actions. It will facilitate the integration of CCA into local development planning and budgeting and support the alignment of the NAP with national development priorities set out in the NDP, the strategic frameworks, the regional and municipal development plans. Outcome 3.4 - ?Adaptation finance increased?: According to the diagnosis carried out in the field (GCF June 2019 mission report), improving access to financing adaptation is based on climate information mastery. The development of knowledge management and sensitization of decision-makers / general public on CCA products while ensuring complementarity with existing processes will facilitate access to climate finance. It will also help design and set up a CCA progress communication and dissemination system with the help of the Regional Development and Planning Commissions and the CORDAT / CRDD Regional Development Commissions.
Total commitment from 01 April 2022 to 30 June 2022
